biography.summary: Richard Blumenthal is an American attorney and politician serving as a United States Senator from Connecticut since 2011. He previously served as Connecticut Attorney General from 1991 to 2011.
biography.early_life: Blumenthal was born on February 13, 1946, and pursued higher education leading to a legal career.
biography.education: Legal education culminating in a Juris Doctor degree.
biography.career: Before entering the Senate, he served as Connecticut's Attorney General and later pursued public service at the state and federal levels.

contact.office_address: 503 Hart Senate Office Building, Washington DC 20510
